<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 265, 222, 280]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 289, 297, 304]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[750, 289, 866, 304]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[725, 314, 866, 329]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 379, 355]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 365, 371, 380]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 397, 214, 412]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 413, 841, 603]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 205, 648]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 649, 697, 680]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 70, 92, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 70, 141, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 70, 472, 87]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\ln (2 + x) - \ln x = 2\ln 3.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 70, 876, 87]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 520, 181, 537]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[176, 520, 875, 555]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\ln (2 + \cot y) - \ln (\cot y) = 2\ln 3\) for \(0< y< \frac{1}{2}\pi\). Give your answer correct to 4 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 537, 875, 555]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 70, 141, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 70, 332, 87]]<|/det|>
Factorise \(x^{4} - 32x + 48\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 70, 876, 87]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 484, 176, 501]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 484, 808, 501]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\mathrm{e}^{-12\mathrm{y}} - 32\mathrm{e}^{-3\mathrm{y}} + 48 = 0\), giving your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 484, 875, 501]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 69, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[237, 79, 744, 228]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 248, 445, 267]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 273, 546, 293]]<|/det|>
\[y = (\ln x)^2 - 2\ln x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 298, 720, 317]]<|/det|>
The curve crosses the \(x\)-axis at the points \(A\) and \(B\), and has a minimum point \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 329, 138, 346]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 329, 742, 346]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of the gradient of the curve at each of the points \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[851, 329, 876, 346]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[72, 69, 89, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[310, 79, 675, 234]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 252, 537, 272]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 279, 589, 298]]<|/det|>
\[x = 4t + \mathrm{e}^{2t},\qquad y = 6t\sin 2t,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 304, 685, 323]]<|/det|>
for \(0\leqslant t\leqslant 1\). The point \(P\) on the curve has parameter \(p\) and \(y\)-coordinate 3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 339, 141, 357]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 336, 332, 364]]<|/det|>
Show that \(p = \frac{1}{2\sin 2p}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 339, 875, 358]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 485, 141, 504]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 485, 638, 504]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that the value of \(p\) lies between 0.5 and 0.6.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[848, 485, 876, 504]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 685, 138, 703]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 685, 876, 733]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part (a), to find the value of \(p\) correct to 3 significant figures. Use an initial value of 0.55 and give the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[846, 714, 875, 733]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[410, 72, 541, 87]]<|/det|>
